events.event_description: Brent crude oil futures averaged $80 per barrel in 2024, $2/b less than 2023, with prices staying in the narrowest trading range since 2019.
events.citation: Benchmark Brent crude oil futures prices averaged $80 per barrel (b) in 2024, $2/b less than in 2023. Intraday prices stayed within a $24/b range, between $68/b and $93/b (after rounding), which was the narrowest trading range since 2019.

events.event_description: Yemen-based Houthi militia attacked vessels in the Red Sea, causing major disruptions as oil tankers had to re-route.
events.citation: Yemen-based Houthi militia began attacking vessels entering the Red Sea in late 2023 and early 2024, causing major trade disruptions as ships, including oil tankers, re-routed to avoid the area.

events.event_description: Brent crude oil prices reached their highest point of 2024 in April, closing at $91/b.
events.citation: Front-month Brent crude oil prices were highest in 2024 during April, closing at $91/b.

events.event_description: OPEC+ made announcements regarding delayed production increases, causing price rallies.
events.citation: Prices generally declined through the remainder of 2024, with smaller price rallies driven by OPEC+ announcements in June and September regarding delayed production increases.

events.event_description: Crude oil prices hit their lowest point of the year at $69/b in early September.
events.citation: In early September, crude oil prices declined to their lowest point of the year at $69/b.

events.event_description: Global oil consumption grew by less than 1 million barrels per day in 2024, below the pre-pandemic decade average of 1.5 million b/d.
events.citation: We estimate global oil consumption grew by less than 1 million barrels per day (b/d) in 2024, less than the annual average growth in the decade before the pandemic of 1.5 million b/d, according to data in our December Short-Term Energy Outlook.
